snippet: Dozens more were ill after surgical sterilizations at a government-run camp, where some women are paid in an effort to control population growth.
abstract: Twelve women have died and dozens more are sickened after undergoing surgical sterilizations at a government-run camp in India; women in country are paid to undergo procedure in effort to control population growth; officials say evidence points to negligence on part of the surgeon, Dr R K Gupta.

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and SUHASINI RAJ
byline.contributor: Hari Kumar and Nida Najar contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Dozens more were ill after surgical sterilizations at a government-run camp, where some women are paid in an effort to control population growth.

headline.main: 12 Women Die After Botched Government Sterilizations in India
headline.print_headline: 12 Women Die After Botched Government Sterilizations in India
